text: The boot of the Han is at your throat. You have two choices - submit, or die.
Han influence and their laws suffocate your growth, and choke your ambitions. Resist with all your being, or be trampled like so many before you.

You have tossed aside your proverbial shackles and rose, with defiance. Plant your feet, grit your teeth, and prepare yourself for the fight of your life. Be wary, though, the influence of the Han runs deep, and centuries of jurisdiction will not so easily be tossed aside.

Standing proudly and tall, you lead your people in a chorus of the songs of old, openly defying the rituals and traditions of those who previously oppressed you. Although the taste of freedom is sweet, there is still much work to be done, as there are others who yearn for amnesty as well. These patriots seek you for guidance, do not let them down.

Rejoice, as deliverance has been earned at last! You have tore aside the laws of the Han, and proclaimed your independence to all who can hear.  You have defied death and won liberty, and it is now your duty to use this hard earned furore to win a place in history!
[[b]]Independence[[/b]] can be increased by winning defensive battles and assignments.
[[b]]Independence[[/b]] can be decreased by losing defensive battles, assignments, and general decay.

For centuries, your people have been stifled under the supervision of the Han. "Ruled" by overlords and Emperors in their far away palaces, and forced to pay taxation and tribute to their regional inspectors and prefects, the Yue clans are slowly being assimilated, their culture and traditions slipping away. Stand for this no more, and break your chains of oppression, and allow the Shanyue to rise once more!
• Independence increases combat capabilities and regional income.
• Independence reduces post battle loot and bandit income.
• Independence can be increased by winning defensive battles and assignments.
• Independence can be decreased by losing defensive battles, assignments, and general decay.

For centuries, your people have been stifled under the supervision of the Han. "Ruled" by overlords and Emperors in their far away palaces, and forced to pay taxation and tribute to their regional inspectors and prefects, the Yue clans are slowly being assimilated, their culture and traditions slipping away. Stand for this no more, and break your chains of oppression, and allow the Shanyue to rise once more!

For centuries, your people have been stifled under the supervision of the Han. "Ruled" by overlords and Emperors in their far away palaces, and forced to pay taxation and tribute to their regional inspectors and prefects, the Yue clans are slowly being assimilated, their culture and traditions slipping away. Stand for this no more, and break your chains of oppression, and allow the Shanyue to rise once more!
You send your attendant to decry the vile taxation imposed on your rightful lands, and speak out against the crimes of the regional governors. Toss the proverbial tea into the harbour, if need be.

Before the local officers get too nosy, it may be best to have your aide hide away your most vocal supports and smuggle them away safely for now. Calm your heads, rebuild your coffers, and await a better chance.
